main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported in Miami, Florida during the early 1950s, including observations by an astronomer and son, a civilian witness, and an Air Force Major.
interesting points: An astronomer and his son reported observing two dark-opaque, circular objects engaged in straight and level maneuvers for 2 seconds in April 1952.
A civilian observer reported a brilliant white object in the sky that could stand still, hover, and then zoom off at high speed with no noise in Hialeah, Florida.

The Air Force Major observed a bright, fast-moving object in the west at about 45 degrees elevation, estimated to be traveling at 1000-1500 mph, and observed for about 30 seconds before it suddenly disappeared.
On April 19, 1952, an unconventional aircraft was reported flying in formation with conventional aircraft at significantly higher speed and altitude in Miami, Florida.
Multiple oval or saucer-shaped objects were sighted flying at an estimated 1000 miles per hour, streaking across the sky and then disappearing over the horizon in April 1952.
witnesses: astronomer, son, civilian observer, Air Force Major, and fighter pilots
